snippet: A $500 million undersea cable connecting the country to the rest of the world is a first step in a plan to turn Iraq into a conduit for Internet traffic between East and West.
abstract: Vast new undersea cable connecting Iraq to the rest of the world is first step in plan to turn the country into a conduit for Internet traffic between East and West, providing it with lucrative revenue from use of the network; $500 million system by Gulf Bridge International could help bring Internet connections to 50 percent of households within two years, where currently fewer than 3 percent are online.
lead_paragraph: A $500 million undersea cable connecting the country to the rest of the world is a first step in a plan to turn Iraq into a conduit for Internet traffic between East and West.

headline.main: Iraq Emerges From Isolation as Telecommunications Hub
headline.print_headline: With a Cable, Iraq Embraces the Digital World
